intro: Copaifera langsdorffii var. peruviana, commonly known as Peruvian copaiba, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and produces a valuable resin known as copaiba balsam. The plant belongs to the family Burseraceae and is known for its aromatic properties. Its bark and leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial effects. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall and thrives in humid, tropical climates.
